page.title: 17PEAT CUTTING IN BACK
page.content: {GENERAL DESCRIPTION Peat is the decayed remains of moorland vegetation. When cut and dried correctly it makes an excellent domestic fuel.It ranges in colour from brown to black,the black peat having a calorific value equal to that of coal. {METHOD OF CUTTING } The turf is skinned away from the moor with a spade and the peats are cut with a {TARAISGEAR}or peat iron. They are laid out to dry and collected into piles as they dry out. When ready they are taken home by tractor. Cutting usually starts in April, and depending on weather, they are home by July. {NEW METHODS The new method of cutting peats is with a machine which cuts the peats into a cylinder shape. {
